intro: Echeandia lehmannii, commonly known as Lehmann's echandia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Chile. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a slender, branched stem and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture.
